rule.author: Seckiot
rule.description: A UDP flood Denial of Service attack involves sending a large number of UDP packets to random ports on a target. This overloads the target's network and resources, leading to performance degradation or unavailability of the service to legitimate users.
rule.name: Denial Of Service - UDP Flood
